alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 11:33AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including Deeth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Marys River Near Deeth. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.6 feet, Moderate flooding occurs on lower marys river, with damage to roads, railroads, and structures. Cattle can be mired or drowned. Streets and homes in deeth flood. This is about 1230 cfs or similar to the flood of may 20, 2005. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM PDT Friday was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.3 feet just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.2 feet on 01/23/1943. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
